snippet: The leader, Ahmad Assi al-Jarba, said that the opposition had already received American antitank missiles, and that the rebels had shown that they could maintain control of advanced weapons.
abstract: Ahmad Assi al-Jarba, head of the Syrian opposition, plans to ask the Obama administration to provide antiaircraft missiles and will try to convince officials that weapons will not fall into the wrong hands; also confirms reports that rebels have received American TOW antitank missiles, saying it has demonstrated the ability to maintain control of advanced weaponry.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: The leader, Ahmad Assi al-Jarba, said that the opposition had already received American antitank missiles, and that the rebels had shown that they could maintain control of advanced weapons.

headline.main: Rebels to Ask for Antiaircraft Missiles
headline.print_headline: Rebels to Ask for Antiaircraft Missiles
